title: Capacitor - potential energy in terms of A d and E

content.question: A parallel-plate capacitor has two plates, each of area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math>, that are separated by a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>. The capacitor is charged, and there is an electric field of magnitude <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> between the plates. What is the electric potential energy stored in the capacitor?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half times epsilon sub 0, end sub, times A E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>A</mi><mi>E</mi></math>

<math alttext="one half times epsilon sub 0, end sub, times A d , times E squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>A</mi><mi>d</mi><msup><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator epsilon sub 0, end sub, times A E, and denominator 2 times d squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>A</mi><mi>E</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator epsilon sub 0, end sub, times A, times E squared, and denominator 2 times d cubed, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>A</mi><msup><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></mrow></mfrac></mpadded></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="one half times epsilon sub 0, end sub, times A d , times E squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>A</mi><mi>d</mi><msup><mi>E</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
